markdownRemark.html:
“Mendicants, you should give up desire … greed … desire and greed for what is suffering. And what is suffering?

Sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts are suffering …”

SN.35.183–185. Bāhirānattachandādisutta (“Desire, Etc. for the Not-Self Exterior”)
